text.text: How do I add a policy for a payer in ZOLL Billing?

text: To add a policy for a payer in ZOLL Billing, you must first create a policy type. Then, you can associate the policy type with the policy.

text.text: Can you guide me through adding a policy for an existing payer

text: To add a policy for an existing payer in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps: 1. Click **Payers** on the navigation bar. 2. On the **Payers** page, find and click the payer name. 3. Click the **Policies** tab. 4. Click **Add a policy**. 5. Enter the required information and then click **Save**.

text.text: What information is required when adding a policy for a payer in ZOLL Billing?

text: To add a policy for a payer in ZOLL Billing, you must provide the following information: Primary submission type, ZirMed remit ID, ZirMed eligibility ID, and electronic filing indicator.

text.text: Explain the significance of policies in ZOLL Billing.

text: Policies in ZOLL Billing are used to define the submission and filing requirements for a payer. Policies can be used as a secondary or tertiary after a Medicaid primary.

text.text: How can I delete a policy for a payer

text: To delete a policy for a payer, you can follow these steps: 1. Click **Payers** on the navigation bar. 2. On the **Payers** page, find and click the payer name. 3. Click the **Policies** tab. 4. Click the **X** under the **Delete** column. The **X** will be disabled if the policy cannot be deleted.

text.text: What types of information can I include when adding a policy for a payer

text: When adding a policy for a payer, you can include the following information:

text.text: Can you provide details on the policy types available in ZOLL Billing?

text: The policy types available in ZOLL Billing are: Insurance, Government, PPO, POS, EPO, Indemnity Insurance, HMO, Medicare Risk, AM, BL.

text.text: How do I associate multiple policy types with a single insurance in ZOLL Billing?

text: You can associate multiple policy types to a single insurance in ZOLL Billing. However, you cannot identify two of the same type such as two commercial policies. Each benefit plan must be associated with a policy, so it is important to identify all the payer's policies first before configuring the benefit plans.

text.text: What is the purpose of the Electronic filing indicator

text: The electronic filing indicator is used on ANSI 837 and ANSI 837P ( Professional ) standard format to electronically transmit health care claims.

text.text: Explain the optional fields for clearinghouse in ZOLL Billing policies.

text: The optional fields for clearinghouse in ZOLL Billing policies are:. Clearinghouse claim ID. Clearinghouse eligibility ID. Provider ID. ZirMed remit ID. ZirMed eligibility ID. Primary submission type. Authorization number. Pending. Validation banners. ZOLL Charges. Rates. Amount. HCPCS. BLS. ALS. ASL2. Mileage. Implementation Services. Last Updated. text.text: How do I set the Primary and Secondary submission types for a payer's policy in ZOLL Billing?

text: To set the Primary and Secondary submission types for a payer's policy in ZOLL Billing, you can click the Policies tab and select the policy from the list. Then, click the "Primary submission" and/or the "Secondary submission" field and select Manual submission from the drop-down list.

text.text: What is the Timely filing claims field used for in ZOLL Billing policies?

text: The Timely filing claims field in ZOLL Billing policies is used to indicate the amount of time the insurance company allows for claim submission. If the timely filing is 90 days, you have up to 90 days from the claim's date of service to submit the claim.

text.text: How do I set default HCPCS for mileage charges for a Medicaid payer

text: To set default HCPCS for mileage charges for a Medicaid payer, you can click Payers on the navigation bar, then find and click the payer name. Next, click the Policies tab and scroll down to the bottom of the page to look for the Default HCPCS for. Enter the HCPCS you want in each field and then click Save & Close.

text.text: How to add a policy?

text: To add a policy, you can click Payers on the navigation bar, then find and click the payer name. Next, click the Policies tab and click Add a policy. Enter the required information and then click Save. You can also click the Policy type field and select Medicaid Managed Care. You can also click the Electronic filing indicator field and select the appropriate indicator.

text.text: policy type

text: A policy type must be associated with the policy when it is created in ZOLL Billing. There are a number of types to choose from, including: Government, Facility, Commercial, PPO, HMO, Medicaid Managed Care. You can associate multiple policy types to a single insurance but you cannot identify two of the same type such as two commercial policies.

text.text: How to delete a policy?

text: To delete a policy, you can click the X under the Delete column on the same line as the policy you wish to delete. The X will be disabled if the policy cannot be deleted. You can also delete a policy if it is not associated with a claim.

text.text: How do I add an allowable amount for a payer in ZOLL Billing?

text: To apply an administered allowable amount to a plan, you can select the allowable amount name from the drop-down menu when you click the Apply an allowable amount field. The Effective date range, Allowable source, and Calculation method fields will change to display the ranges administered for that allowable amount.

text.text: Can you guide me through adding an allowable amount for a payer

text: To add an allowable amount for a payer, you can configure the allowable amount in Payers and associate it with the benefit plan for that payer. You can also apply an administered allowable amount to a plan by selecting the allowable amount name from the drop-down menu when you click the Apply an allowable amount field.

text.text: What types of allowable amounts can I set up in ZOLL Billing?

text: In ZOLL Billing, you can set up the following types of allowable amounts: * Effective date range * Allowable source * Calculation method

text.text: Explain the process of setting up a flat amount per HCPCS as an allowable amount in ZOLL Billing.

text: To set up a flat amount per HCPCS as an allowable amount in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps: 1. Select the **Flat amount per HCPCS** tab. 2. Select **Contracted** if the HCPCS are contracted. 3. Select **Not contracted** if they are not. 4. Enter the allowable amount name. 5. Click **Save**.

text.text: What is the significance of the Flat Amount per HCPCS option in ZOLL Billing's allowable amounts?

text: The Flat Amount per HCPCS option is used to configure the charge amount that your company pays for a HCPCS related service or procedure.

text.text: How do I configure a percentage of Medicare fee schedule as an allowable amount in ZOLL Billing?

text: To configure a percentage of Medicare fee schedule as an allowable amount in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps: 1. Select the **% of Medicare fee schedule** tab. 2. Enter the percentage of the Medicare fee schedule that the payer will pay. 3. Click **Save**.

text.text: Can you explain how to set up a Percent of Charge Amount allowable amount

text: To set up a Percent of Charge Amount allowable amount in ZOLL Billing, you can follow these steps: 1. Select the **% of charge amount** tab. 2. Enter the percentage of a configured charge that the payer will pay. 3. Click **Save**.

text.text: What information is required when adding a flat amount per HCPCS as an allowable amount

text: To add a flat amount per HCPCS as an allowable amount, you need to provide the following information: 1. Select the **Flat amount per HCPCS** tab. 2. Select **Contracted** if the HCPCS are contracted. 3. Click **Continue**. 4. Enter the allowable amount name. 5. Click **Save**.

text.text: What details do I need to provide when setting up a percentage of Medicare fee schedule as an allowable amount in ZOLL Billing?

text: To configure a percentage of Medicare fee schedule as an allowable amount in ZOLL Billing, you need to provide the following information: 1. Select the **% of Medicare fee schedule** tab. 2. Enter the percentage of the Medicare fee schedule that the payer will pay. 3. Click **Save**.

text.text: Explain the fields required when configuring a Percent of Charge Amount allowable amount in ZOLL Billing

text: To configure a Percent of Charge Amount allowable amount in ZOLL Billing, you need to provide the following information: 1. Select the % of charge amount tab. 2. Enter the percentage of a configured charge that the payer will pay. 3. Click Save.

text.text: How do I specify the effective date range for an allowable amount

text: To specify the effective date range for an allowable amount, you can follow these steps: 1. Click the **Effective date range** tab. 2. Enter the start date and end date for the allowable amount. 3. Click **Save**.

text.text: Can you clarify how to add multiple effective date ranges for an allowable amount

text: To add multiple effective date ranges for an allowable amount, you can follow these steps: 1. Click the **Add effective date ranges** button. 2. Enter the start date, end date, and amount for the new effective date range. 3. Click **Save**.

text.text: What should I consider when adding a second date range for an allowable amount

text: Adding a second date range does not automatically set an end date for the first range. That must be done manually. If you do not set an end date on the first date range, the expected amounts on the claim, values during payment posting, and certain reports may contain inaccurate values.

text.text: How do I add a mileage HCPCS as an allowable amount

text: To add a mileage HCPCS as an allowable amount, you can follow these steps: 1. Click the edit icon on the left side of the Charges tab 2. Click inside the Add a charge field and select the mileage HCPCS from the list 3. In the " Units " field, enter the mileage amount.

text.text: What is the significance of the Percent of Medicare Fee Schedule option in ZOLL Billing's allowable amounts?

text: The Percent of Medicare Fee Schedule option is used to set the percentage level. This option is selected if the payer pays a percentage more or less than Medicare.

text.text: Flat Amount per HCPCS

text: The Flat Amount per HCPCS option is used to change HCPCS charges for a date range. This option is selected if the payer pays a different flat rate amount than the amount entered on the Charges page.

text.text: How to select flat amount per HCPCS?

text: To select flat amount per HCPCS, you can follow these steps: 1. Select the Flat amount per HCPCS tab. 2. Select Contracted if the HCPCS are contracted. 3. Select Not contracted if they are not. 4. Enter the allowable amount name. 5. Click Save.

text.text: Percent of Medicare Fee Schedule

text: The Percent of Medicare Fee Schedule option is selected if the payer pays a percentage more or less than Medicare.

text.text: What all details to be filled in percent of charge amount?

text: The details to be filled in Percent of Charge Amount are: Allowable amount name, Date range start, Date range end, Calculation method, Percentage.
